title: Did David stab Josh in Coronation Street and does he get out of prison?
text:
David denies having anything to do with the attack (Picture: ITV)

Coronation Street’s David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) found himself in trouble with the law once again after Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton) was viciously stabbed during the prison riot.

Given the pair’s history, David becomes the prime suspect in the investigation despite his insistence he had nothing to do with the incident.

As David is charged with attempted murder it begs the question: did he seek revenge on his rapist?

Did David stab Josh in Coronation Street?

It’s unknown whether David was the one to stab Josh, but the truth will no doubt unravel soon.

The prison riot provided the opportune moment for David to exact revenge on Josh, who was brought by Abe to his cell.

Handing David the pair of scissors, Abe pushed David to attack his attacker but he refused to.

Josh admits to raping David (Picture: ITV)

However when Josh finally admits to raping David and continues to aggravate him, David appears to advance towards him, weapon in hand.

When questioned by the police, David is presented with a video which shows him hovering near Josh holding the scissors used in the attack.

Despite the seeming evidence against him, David professes his innocence.

Does David get out of prison?

David attends a hearing at the Magistrate’s Court where he, Abe and Tez all plead not guilty to the attempted murder of Josh. However he is refused bail and remanded in custody until the trial.

Meanwhile his fiancée Shona (Julia Goulding) has to decide whether to pay the balance of money toward their wedding venue.

If it all goes south for David, they may need the money for legal bills…

Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays on ITV at 7.30pm.
